channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pile of litter all over pavement, 20th December
item.description:
Issue is not “fixed”. You closed the previous job and said “ Litter & leaves should be cleared by sweepers.” They should, but they don’t. So…

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The mattress next to the building and other waste, 20th December
item.description:
Almost every third day we have pieces of furniture, mattresses, other items left next to the entrance. We would be grateful if you could take steps to prevent this from occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnham Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tent..., 20th December
item.description:
Person living here for three months at least. Reported to Streetscape. Still there. Is this allowed? It seems to be.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spenser Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pavement outside 122-130 Wigmore Street, 20th December
item.description:
Lime bikes blocking pavement outside 122-130 Wigmore Street need to clear out from road and cycle parking. Need to clear out causing nuisance and hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Wigmore Street, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lampost 12 charging point., 20th December
item.description:
This is in a dangerous location as very close to a cross road vehicles charging impede traffic flow or park all wheels On pavement, I have seen numerous close calls when I have been exiting swanbridge road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Wenvoe Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worsening Dangerous obstruction Beckenham Lane, 20th December
item.description:
It's a cover that's loose that making massive noise every time a car passes over its getting worse which means it's getting looser and dangerous as it will just flip and cause an accident. It's also an impossible noise for surrounding houses

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glebe Knoll, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous issue, 20th December
item.description:
It really is unacceptable that the street lights between Whaley Road and Sainsburys car park are still not working. This area is pitch black in the evening and very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Estate Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped bins and boxes, 20th December
item.description:
There are overflowing bins and boxes on Charleston Street that are piling up. This is becoming a serious health concern. This has already been "resolved" once but nobody has come and taken it. Please can I ask that this be resolved and taken?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charleston Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Berries from small tree on pavement by blue recycling bins near Woodville Court, Blissett Street SE10 8UU, 20th December
item.description:
This is a beautiful tree and it does not need any attention. But please can the pavement area be given a good sweep as it's difficult to avoid treading on the berries when using the blue recycle bins here. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blissett Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous....Light on top of post damage/come off, 20th December
item.description:
Light housing hanging by wires from top of lamp,on the 1st lamp post on entering Bruce grove orpington.20/12/25 11am
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Hill, Goddington, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti black tag on door of Jubilee Hall Greenwich South Street, 20th December
item.description:
The Jubilee Hall has been repurposed for housing, There are black graffiti tags on the PVC door on Greenwich South Street SE10 8NT or SE10 8UU as part of Woodville Court in Blissett Street. This graffiti has been left for a good few weeks and spoils the appearance of the building, Please remove thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blissett Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight out at crossing, 20th December
item.description:
Streetlight out on island in Peckham Road, at crossing point outside UAL Camberwell College of Arts. It’s a busy place to cross for children and students and makes them almost invisible in the dusk and dark. Issue has been present for many months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45-65, Peckham Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dirty streets slippery for cyclists and pedestrians, 20th December
item.description:
Deeley Road, near the playground, hasn't been street-cleaned and it very dirty and slippery. It's dangerous cycling or even walking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deeley Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thick leaves build up a becoming ver slippery, 20th December
item.description:
Thick build up of leaves very slippery

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchwood Road, Poverest, Greater London

Residents using incorrect bins, left to overflow litter now on streets for circa 6 weeks. Rodents seen.

item.title: Dead fox on footpath at corner of Okehampton Crescent & Lyme Road near Zebra Crossing, 20th December
item.description:
Dead fox on footpath at corner of Okehampton Crescent & Lyme Road near Zebra Crossing. Please remove as healthy hazard to public, especially children. Thank you

item.title: Granville Centre, Granville Road, NW6 5AR, 20th December
item.description:
Mattress DUMPED in front of Work Site. NEEDS REMOVING as it WILL become a FLY TIP.

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Bristol Walk , BLOCK,2,3,4,11 NW6, 20th December
item.description:
This FLY TIP is GETTING BIGGER EACH DAY and WEEK. It has been there for WEEKS . What had happened to Brent Council? WHERE ARE THE BIN MEN, WHERE ARE THE STREET CLEANERS? WHERE ARE THE ESTATE CLEANERS? SHAME on WHO is RESPONSIBLE for this Area and THIS BLOCK. People LIVE O this Block Passersby have to Pass this NASTY MESS of A FLY TIP THAT is NOW OUT OF CONTROL. There are RATS SEEN, FOXES, it’s DISGUSTING and DISGRACEFUL. Whoever has CUT the Waste, FLY TIPPING and LITTER Service in Brent NEEDS to Walk down These Streets and See what is going on, NOTHING . Brent Council are ONLY BUILDING MORE FLATS , they are NOT TACKLING the LITTER and FLY TIPPING PROBLEMS this Borough Council HAS. This FLY TIP is a MAJOR HEALTH HAZARD, NO ONE Comes to Check ANYTHING ANYMORE. It’s SO SAD. Brent Council and Living in Brent, is NO LONGER NICE. Brent Council has Recently been VOTED ONE of The WORST BOROUGHS TO LIVE. These FLY TIPS and The LACK OF CARE For EACH STREET is CLEARLY WHY Whoever is in Charge of the WASTE, LITTER, RECYCLE and FLY TIP DEPARTMENTS, should BE ASHAMED of THEMSELVES. This FLY TIP MUST BE REMOVED ASAP, There is a School Nearby, Elderly Residents, EVERYBODY.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alpha Place, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load
